title: Near Optimal Bayesian Active Learning for Decision Making
abstract: How should we gather information to make effective decisions? We address Bayesian active learning and experimental design problems, where we sequentially select tests to reduce uncertainty about a set of hypotheses. Instead of minimizing uncertainty per se, we consider a set of overlapping decision regions of these hypotheses. Our goal is to drive uncertainty into a single decision region as quickly as possible.
histories: Extended version of work appearing in the International conference on Artificial Intelligence and Statistics (AISTATS) 2014
